findings.title: Lack of Slippage Control in _decreasePosition()
findings.description: In the `Perpetual` protocol, the `FutureRouter` contract lacks an effective slippage control in the `_decreasePosition()` function.

findings.title: Revisited Validation of maxLeverage in decreaseMargin()
findings.description: The `decreaseMargin()` routine does not properly check if the new leverage has exceeded the maximum leverage or not.

findings.title: Proper Validation of Size Delta in increasePosition()
findings.description: The `Future` contract's `increasePosition()` function lacks validation to ensure the size delta cannot be 0, allowing traders to keep the position size unchanged while increasing the open notional.

findings.title: Improved Calculation of New Margin in validateLiquidate()
findings.description: In the `Future` contract, wrong parameters values are used to calculate the remain margin and the margin ratio of the position in the `validateLiquidate()` routine.

findings.title: Revisited Validation of Pair Status in liquidatePosition()
findings.description: The `Future` contract does not properly validate the pair status to ensure the pair is not unlisted before allowing liquidation.

findings.title: Revised Withdrawal of ETH in cancelIncreaseOrder()
findings.description: In the `FutureRouter` contract, the `cancelIncreaseOrder()` function mistakenly uses `futureLimit` as `WETH`, causing it to withdraw `ETH` incorrectly.

findings.title: Revised Logic in decreasePositionETH()
findings.description: Possible denial-of-service issue within current implementation of `decreasePositionETH()` routine in `FutureRouter` contract, where validation of `_receiver` will fail and the transaction reverts.

findings.title: Trust Issue on Admin Keys
findings.description: In the Perpetual protocol, there is a privileged account, i.e., owner, that plays a critical role in regulating the protocol-wide operations and has the ability to update specific pairs, set trading fee rates, set max leverage, etc.
